Project_Advanced_Labor_Cost_Calculation_.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

If Y, the calculated cost rate can't exceed the base cost rate from the standard cost rate sheets.

Project_Advanced_Labor_Cost_Calculation_.description: When including Company Holiday, the Actual Hours Included recognizes holidays defined in the Holiday Calendar. When submitting time entries for holidays, then exclude Company Holiday and include Absence.
If Y, the scheduled weekly hours are based on the worker primary position.
If entered, the worker scheduled hours for the week override the worker primary position information.
If N, worker schedule hours decrease by the number of absence hours logged that week.
If N, worker schedule hours decrease by the number of holidays occurring that week.
If Y, Total Hours includes Non-Project Time

Project_Advanced_Labor_Costing_Premium_T.description: Project Advanced Labor Costing Premium Time Tier Referenc
For second tier and after, match the previous tier Hours To value to this value.

validation.validation: Enter a whole number for Hours From.

Project_Advanced_Labor_Costing_Premium_T.description: Hours To in Premium Time Tier

validation.validation: Enter a whole number for Hours To.

Project_Advanced_Labor_Cost_Calculation_.description: Project Advanced Labor Costing Premium Time Tier Data

validation.validation: Either leave this field blank, or enter a unique Premium Time Tier ID.
Your Hours From value must be less than the Hours To value.
Workday requires a valid Premium Time Tier ID when you enter Y for the Delete column.
Match the amount for the Hours From in this tier with the Hours To in the previous tier.
Enter a unique number for Hours From.
Enter a unique number for Hours To.

description: Project Advanced Labor Cost Calculation Type Data

validation.validation: When you clear the Delete, enter Type Name, Calculation Method, and Start Day of Week.
Either leave this field blank, or enter a unique Premium Time Tier ID.
Leave the Base Cost Rate Is Max field blank for nonsalaried calculation methods.
Enter Y, for Total Hours Included Scheduled Weekly Hours, or a value for Total Hours Included Specified Scheduled Hours, but not both.
Enter 1 or more Hours From, Hours To and Percentage sets for nonsalaried calculation methods.
Enter zero in the Hours From column of your first premium time tier.
Match the amount for the Hours From in this tier with the Hours To in the previous tier.
Premium Time Tier can’t be configured if you select Base Cost Rate Is Max.
